original: Karl Harry, vicekon-sul, Borås, f. 1/12/95 i Borås av Karl W. o. Lina Johansson. G. 28 m. Martha Johansson-Rutstedt. Barn: Bengt f. 29, Åke 31, Göran 36. — Etabl. efter praktik v. större textilföretag tills. mi. ibrod. Nils W. faibr:-o. handelsfirman Bröderna Wennerlund i Borås 17. Polsk vicekonsul sed. 37. Led. av folksk :styr., kristidsstyr., ordf. i Älvsb. läns Solsticka, styr. f. pens:heimm(et i Borås, fören. Borås sommar ko lon., bygign : för en. Ve ritas, s’tift. Borås scoutkår, sekr. i Barnens d’a.g led. av styr. f. Sv. Röda korsets Älvsib -distr., A-B Borås Tennishall, Majbloimiman, ledare o. general f. Barnens dag i Borås sed. 32, styr:led. i Sv :es Barnens dagsledares fören. Föret. stud:resor t. flert. europ. länder samt USA, Mexiko, Västind., Nordafr,, Egypten, Palestina, Syrien m. fl. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd Fellov^, Tempelriddarorden, 95 års män. Skr.: 25 år i varudistributionens tjänst (42). Hobbies : resor, tennis, soc. verksamh. RVO, SvRKGM, PolRKftjt2ki, Sv. scoutförb. Ht. , Harry, grosshandlare, Göteborg, f. 217/9/87 i Gällivare, Norrb. 1., av civiling. Henrik W. o. Anna Go-venius. G. 1. 13-24 m. Olga Philipson ; 2. 28 m;. Dagny Hallgren. Barn: Ulla f. 14, g. m. Air Commodore RAF R. L. P|hillips, London, Margaretha 16, g. m. apot. Stellan Holmdahl, Qbg, Gunnar 18, civilekon., anst. i f :a Nordström & Tinggren, Gbg, g. m. Solveig Fagerberg, Nils-Henrik 29, stud. — Mog:ex. i Upps. 07, reservoff :ex. 09. Anst. v. Sv. Lifförsäkr :bol. 09-13, Brand- & Lifförsäkr. A-B Svea 10-13, inneh. av pappersengrosfirman Nordström| & Tinggren i Gbg sed. 13, tillika verkst. dir. i Nya A-B Asfaltpapp sed. 312. Kassaförv. i Gbgs handels- o. sjö-f :nd samt i KAK västra avd., fullm. i Gbgs handelskaimm. Äger o. brukar Stora Klevs egendom i Släp, Hall.
translated:
Karl Harry, vice consul, Borås, b. 1/12/95 in Borås to Karl W. and Lina Johansson. Married on 28/xx/xx to Martha Johansson-Rutstedt. Children: Bengt b. 29, Åke b. 31, Göran b. 36. Established after an internship at a major textile company together with his brother Nils W.'s father-in-law and the trade firm Bröderna Wennerlund in Borås in 1917. Polish vice consul since 1937. Member of the school board, war-time board, chairman of Älvsborg County Solsticka, board member of the pension home in Borås, association for Borås summer colony, building committee for a church in Ve rita, foundation of Borås scout troop, secretary of the Children's Day, board member of the Swedish Red Cross Älvsib district, A-B Borås Tennishall, Mayflowerman, leader and general for Children's Day in Borås since 1932, board member of the Swedish Children's Day Leaders Association. Business study trips to several European countries as well as the USA, Mexico, West Indies, North Africa, Egypt, Palestine, Syria, among others. Member of the Freemason Order, Odd Fellows, Knight Templar Order, 95-year-old men's club. Written: 25 years in the service of merchandise distribution (1942). Hobbies: travelling, tennis, social activities. Recipient of the Order of Vasa, Swedish Red Cross Golden Medal, Polish Red Cross Medal, Swedish Scout Association Medal. 

Harry, merchant, Gothenburg, b. 27/9/87 in Gällivare, Norrbotten, son of civil engineer Henrik W. and Anna Govenius. Married on 1st 13-24/xx/xx to Olga Philipson; 2nd on 28/xx/xx to Dagny Hallgren. Children: Ulla b. 14, married to Air Commodore RAF R. L. Phillips, London, Margaretha b. 16, married to pharmacist Stellan Holmdahl, Gothenburg, Gunnar b. 18, economist, employed at Nordström & Tinggren, Gothenburg, married to Solveig Fagerberg, Nils-Henrik b. 29, student. Economics degree from Uppsala University in 1907, reserve officer examination in 1909. Employed at Swedish Life Insurance Company from 1909-1913, Brand- & Life Insurance A-B Svea from 1910-1913. Owner of the paper wholesale firm Nordström & Tinggren in Gothenburg since 1913, also managing director of Nya A-B Asfaltpapp since 1931. Cashier for Gothenburg's trade and maritime chamber and the Swedish Automobile Association's Western Division, proxy for Gothenburg's Chamber of Commerce. Owns and operates the Stora Klevs estate in Släp, Halland.

structured.name: Karl Harry
structured.description: Karl Harry, born on December 1, 1895 in Borås, was a Swedish Vice Consul. He was married to Martha Johansson-Rutstedt. They had three children: Bengt (born in 1929), Åke (born in 1931), and Göran (born in 1936). Karl established himself after an internship at the textile company Bröderna Wennerlund in Borås in 1917. In 1937, he became the Polish Vice Consul. Karl was actively involved in various organizations and committees, including the Älvsborg County Solsticka, Borås Summer Colony, Vetritas Church Building Committee, and Borås Scout Troop. He also held positions such as Secretary of the Children's Day, board member of the Swedish Red Cross Älvsib District, and board member of A-B Borås Tennishall. Karl participated in business study trips to several European countries, the USA, Mexico, West Indies, North Africa, Egypt, Palestine, Syria, among others. He was a member of Frimurarorden, Odd Fellows, Knight Templar Order, and the 95-year-old men's club. Karl Harry passed away on an unknown date.
